content: Autofocus tracking for people and pets is seriously improved; face/eye detect locks quickly and stays sticky during bursts.
Autofocus is quick in daylight but hunts a bit in very low light.
Build quality feels solid with a grippy body and weather sealing. The camera is a bit heavy after long shoots, but the balance is good with most native lenses.
For video, oversampled 4K looks crisp and rolling shutter is controlled. In-body stabilization helps for handheld, though electronic modes can crop.
The price is high for beginners; great for enthusiasts who can afford it. Battery life is decent but not class‑leading.
JPEG colors are pleasing with natural skin tones, and RAW files have solid dynamic range for landscape edits.
Not the best choice for wildlife—AF tracking can miss erratic birds in flight, and the buffer fills quickly in RAW bursts.
Weather sealing held up in light rain and dusty trails. The shutter sounds refined and vibrations are minimal.
Menu system still feels cluttered and some settings are buried. The touchscreen is responsive but could be brighter in sunlight.
Excellent low‑light performance; clean files up to ISO 6400 and usable above with noise reduction. Great for indoor events and available light street.
